intro: Atropatenia, commonly known as the "butterfly plant," is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its showy, daisy-like flowers that attract pollinators such as butterflies and bees. The plants typically have narrow, grass-like leaves and are native to arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa. Atropatenia species are often found growing in rocky soils and are adapted to withstand drought conditions. Their botanical features make them valuable in ecological studies and horticultural applications.
